@ clone94 

This info is added to registry by that file :

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeValveSteam]
"InstallPath"="C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam"

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESoftwareValveSteam]
"InstallPath"="C:\Program Files\Steam"



If you have installed STEAM on other location open Regedit and delete this info

I do not recommend this torrent one bit. As soon as it was completed installing, a screen opened that would not allow me to close it or switch to another open window. It claimed to be the FBI having locked down my computer on suspicion of illegal activity, though legal action could be stopped with one easy payment of $200.

I quickly restarted in safe mode and performed a system restore. My fault for not employing better anti-malware software. Still, don't download this shit.

My new computer came with windows 8, and I got the skidrow version of the crack to work (found updated windows 8 crack). If I use this cumulative update it regresses to the previous problem I had before, which was every time I tried to launch the game, nothing happened. No messages, no errors, it just thinks for a sec, then nothing happens.  For now I'm just playing the non-updated version. Would really appreciate some advice.

@reinku:  The "FBI Moneypack" trojan/malware/whatever is the result of surfing web-sites with compromised ads.  Cleaning up after it is as simple as shutting down any rundll32.exe processes (IIRC) and then deleting any and all .exe, .dll, and just to be safe .sys files from your usersprofileappdatalocaltemp folder and then deleting the startup link it created either in your registry or startup folder.

It's not the fault of this download and a system restore point was either overkill or useless if not both.
